title: Zohran Mamdani Is Sworn In as Mayor of New York City
summary: Zohran Mamdani officially took office as mayor after the New Year’s Eve ball drop, in a private ceremony held at a shuttered relic of the city’s subway.

title: Mamdani Names Transportation Chief With Job of Making Buses Fast and Free
summary: As commissioner of New York City’s Department of Transportation, Michael Flynn will seek to implement one of the new mayor’s central campaign planks.

title: Mamdani Reverses Call to End Mayoral Control of NYC Public Schools
summary: The mayor-elect’s turnaround came as he selected Kamar Samuels to lead New York City’s school system at a precarious moment.

title: Mamdani Is First New York Mayor to Use the Quran at His Swearing-In
summary: Zohran Mamdani, New York City’s first Muslim mayor, put his hand on Islam’s holiest book at his swearing-in ceremony.

title: Another New Year at War: Ukraine’s Troops Doubt It Will Be the Last
summary: After a year of Russian advances, the goal for 2026 is simply to survive, said one officer in eastern Ukraine. “It’s hard to make any plans,” he said.

title: Ukraine Did Not Target Putin’s Home, C.I.A. Finds
summary: The assessment rebutted a claim that the Russian leader made to President Trump in a phone call this week.

title: Trump Abandons Efforts to Deploy National Guard to 3 Major Cities
summary: The troops had nearly no presence in two of the cities, Portland and Chicago. But the decision signaled a retreat, at least for now, in one of the president’s most audacious attempts to test his power.

title: Trump Must Return Command of California National Guard to Newsom, Court Rules
summary: The ruling is a win for Gov. Gavin Newsom, who has vigorously opposed President Trump’s moves to control California’s National Guard since the summer.

title: In Hearing Transcript, Jack Smith Defends Decision to Indict Trump
summary: The former special counsel accused President Trump of “exploiting” violence on Jan. 6, 2021, according to an interview released by House Republicans.

title: He’s Chevy Chase, and He’s Still Like That
summary: The famously prickly comedian found a sympathetic adversary in the director of a CNN documentary about him. Their conversation with a reporter was … spirited.

title: Oil Tanker Fleeing the Coast Guard Now Listed in Russian Ship Database
summary: The listing could make it more challenging for U.S. forces to board the ship, which an arm of the Kremlin’s maritime authority says is now flying the Russian flag.

title: Coast Guard Searches for Survivors After More Boat Strikes
summary: The U.S. military attacked a convoy of three boats in the eastern Pacific on Tuesday, and two more on Wednesday, as part of the Trump administration’s campaign against people suspected of drug trafficking.

title: Space Events 2026: NASA’s Artemis II Moon Mission, Summer Eclipse and More
summary: In 2026, there will be journeys to the moon and Mars, new visions of the cosmos and a solar eclipse that might be worth traveling for.

title: Even the Sky May Not Be the Limit for A.I. Data Centers
summary: Some tech leaders are concerned that the artificial intelligence race will exhaust available land and energy. The solution might lie in orbit.

title: Trump’s Veto of Water Project Is His Latest Targeted Hit on Colorado
summary: The president seems to be at war with the Democratic-led state as he raises the pressure on Colorado leaders to release a convicted election denier, Tina Peters, from state prison.

title: Trump Vetoes 2 Bills, Drawing Accusations of Retaliation
summary: The president said he blocked the bills to save taxpayers’ money. But he has grievances against a tribe in Florida and officials in Colorado.

title: 3 Years After a Toddler’s Parents Fled Kabul, a Reunion Is Still on Hold
summary: The twisting saga that separated the Hashemis in Oregon from their infant son has reached a new dead end: President Trump’s hold on all visas to the United States.

title: Repeat Moviegoers Help Hollywood Eke Out a Slightly Better 2025
summary: Ticket sales in North America totaled $8.9 billion for the year, up 2 percent from 2024. But the box office remains far below prepandemic levels.

title: A Year of Fires and Floods in Southern California
summary: The floods that struck last week just before the first anniversary of the January wildfires show how extreme weather is defining life in the L.A. region.

title: Behind Oklahoma Cannabis Farms, New Yorkers With Ties to Beijing
summary: In China, trafficking marijuana is punishable by death. But in the United States, it has become a lucrative sideline for some favored sons of the motherland.

title: ‘Stranger Things’ Has Ended. What Happened in the Series Finale?
summary: There was a lot to tie up after five seasons and nearly 10 years, and the show gave itself another two hours to do it. Here are the major events.

title: The Two Questions I Wish We’d Stop Asking in 2026
summary: How did we get here? I don’t want to know.

title: The Economy Made It Through 2025. The New Year Will Be Harder.
summary: The new year will pose numerous problems that won’t be so easily overcome.

title: Hope in a Time of Cynicism
summary: At a moment when Americans are distrusting and fearful, we examine the psychology of hope.

title: Most of Iran Shuts Down as Government Grapples With Protests and Economy
summary: Amid mounting street protests, businesses, universities and government offices stayed closed Wednesday under government orders, in 21 of 31 provinces, including Tehran.

title: Historic Snowstorm Blankets Syracuse Just in Time for the New Year
summary: Syracuse, N.Y., has received nearly twice its usual monthly amount of snow in December.

title: Tatiana Schlossberg Submitted a Heartbreaking Essay to The New Yorker on Her Cancer Diagnosis, Fully Formed
summary: When Tatiana Schlossberg submitted an essay to The New Yorker, it had not been assigned or even expected. It was accepted immediately and barely edited.

title: Brigitte Bardot’s Legacy of Racist Rhetoric
summary: The actress, who died this week at 91, was an icon of 1960s cinema. She was also a hero to the French far right.
